title: Delicious Holiday Cranberry Jalape√±o Dip (20 Minutes!)

description: This holiday cranberry jalape√±o dip is a must-try! A perfect blend of tart cranberries and spicy jalape√±os creates a delightful appetizer. Ideal for festive gatherings or cozy nights in. Save this recipe for your next celebration! üéâ
ingredients: 2 cups fresh cranberries, rinsed and drained
1/2 cup fresh jalape√±os, seeded and chopped
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine cranberries, jalape√±os, and sugar. Cook over medium heat until cranberries burst and mixture thickens, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
In a mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, sour cream, salt, and lime juice. Mix until smooth.
Fold in the cooled cranberry mixture and cilantro until well combined.
Transfer to a serving bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.
tips: To achieve the best flavor, use fresh cranberries and adjust jalape√±o levels based on your spice preference. Avoid overcooking the cranberries to maintain their texture. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. For a creamier dip, consider adding more cream cheese. Always taste and adjust seasoning before serving to ensure the perfect balance.

structured_content.content: This holiday cranberry jalape√±o dip is a festive delight that perfectly balances tartness and spice. The burst of fresh cranberries combined with the heat of jalape√±os creates a unique flavor that will have your guests coming back for more. It's not just a dip; it's a conversation starter at any gathering. The vibrant colors and creamy texture make it visually appealing, and the best part? It comes together in just 20 minutes! Perfect for holiday parties, family gatherings, or cozy nights in, this dip is sure to impress.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and ready in just 20 minutes - perfect for last-minute gatherings.
  • Combines sweet and spicy flavors for a unique taste experience.
  • Ideal for holiday parties, potlucks, or cozy evenings at home.
  • Uses simple ingredients that are easy to find.
  • Vegetarian and gluten-free, making it suitable for various dietary needs.
  • Can be made ahead of time for stress-free entertaining.

structured_content.content: I discovered this cranberry jalape√±o dip at a holiday party years ago, and it quickly became a favorite among my friends and family. The combination of tart cranberries and spicy jalape√±os is simply irresistible! I love making it for gatherings because it‚Äôs always a hit, and people are often surprised by how easy it is to prepare. It brings back memories of laughter and joy shared around the table, making it a cherished recipe in my collection.

Main ingredient (cranberries): Fresh cranberries are essential for their tartness and texture. Look for firm, bright berries without blemishes. Frozen cranberries can be used but may alter the texture slightly.
Key seasonings/aromatics: Jalape√±os add a spicy kick; adjust the amount based on your heat preference. Fresh cilantro enhances the flavor with its aromatic freshness.
Supporting ingredients: Cream cheese and sour cream provide a creamy base that balances the tartness of the cranberries.
Smart substitutions: For a dairy-free version, substitute cream cheese and sour cream with vegan alternatives. For a sweeter dip, consider adding a touch of honey or maple syrup.
Equipment needed: A medium saucepan for cooking and a mixing bowl for combining ingredients are essential for this recipe.

upload.context: Fresh cranberries, jalape√±os, cream cheese, and cilantro arranged on a kitchen counter, ready for dip preparation

structured_content.content:
Before you start cooking, gather all your ingredients and equipment. Rinse the cranberries and chop the jalape√±os. Measure out your sugar and prepare your mixing bowl with cream cheese and sour cream. This mise en place will make the cooking process smooth and efficient.
Preparation phase: In a medium saucepan, combine the cranberries, jalape√±os, and sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the cranberries burst and the mixture thickens, about 10 minutes.
Cooking/Baking process: Once the mixture is thickened, remove it from heat and let it cool slightly. This cooling step is crucial for the flavors to meld together.
Finishing touches: After cooling, mix in the cream cheese, sour cream, and cilantro. Transfer to a serving bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to develop.

upload.context: Stirring the cranberry jalape√±o mixture in a saucepan on the stovetop, showcasing vibrant colors and textures

note.label: Critical Tips You Must Know
note.content:
• Temperature precision: Cook the cranberry mixture over medium heat to ensure even cooking and prevent burning. Stir regularly to avoid sticking.
  • Common mistake to avoid: Avoid overcooking the cranberries; they should burst but not turn mushy. Keep an eye on them during cooking.
  • Perfect doneness indicator: The mixture is ready when the cranberries have burst and the sauce has thickened to a syrupy consistency.
  • Storage & reheating: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. This dip is best served cold, so no reheating is necessary.

structured_content.content: Sharing this cranberry jalape√±o dip with friends and family brings so much joy. Watching their faces light up with delight as they take their first bite is incredibly rewarding. It's become a staple at my holiday gatherings, sparking laughter and conversation around the table. The vibrant colors and delicious flavors create an inviting atmosphere, making every occasion feel special. I love hearing requests for the recipe, knowing that this dip has made a lasting impression on everyone who tries it.

To enhance your cranberry jalape√±o dip, consider these options:

  • Fresh herbs: Add chopped green onions or chives for a mild onion flavor. Cilantro can be increased for more freshness.
  • Spice additions: A pinch of cayenne pepper can elevate the heat level. Start with 1/4 teaspoon and adjust to taste.
  • Ingredient upgrades: Incorporate crumbled feta cheese for a tangy twist or diced avocado for creaminess.
  • Technique variations: Try roasting the jalape√±os before adding them for a smoky flavor, or blend the dip for a smoother texture.

To serve this dip successfully, consider these suggestions:

  • Side dishes: Pair with tortilla chips for crunch, or serve with fresh vegetable sticks for a healthier option.
  • Beverage pairings: A light white wine, like Sauvignon Blanc, complements the dip's flavors beautifully. For non-alcoholic options, try sparkling water with lime.
  • Bread/starch options: Offer slices of toasted baguette or pita chips for dipping.
  • Occasion ideas: This dip is perfect for holiday parties, game day gatherings, or casual get-togethers with friends.
  • Presentation tips: Garnish the dip with additional cilantro or jalape√±o slices for a pop of color. Serve in a festive bowl to enhance the holiday spirit.
  • Temperature serving note: This dip is best served chilled, making it ideal for make-ahead entertaining.

Explore these variations to keep the recipe exciting:

  • Dietary adaptation 1 (e.g., Gluten-Free): This recipe is naturally gluten-free, making it accessible for all guests.
  • Dietary adaptation 2 (e.g., Vegan/Dairy-Free): Substitute cream cheese and sour cream with vegan alternatives like cashew cream or coconut yogurt for a dairy-free version.
  • Flavor variation (e.g., Spicy, Mediterranean): Add roasted red peppers for a Mediterranean twist, or increase the jalape√±os for a spicier kick.
  • Protein/ingredient swap: Incorporate diced cooked chicken or turkey for a heartier dip that‚Äôs perfect for gatherings.

upload.context: Beautifully plated cranberry jalape√±o dip garnished with cilantro and served with tortilla chips on a festive table setting

note.label: Pro Chef Secrets
note.content:
• Restaurant technique: To enhance flavors, consider toasting the jalape√±os before adding them to the dip. This brings out their natural sweetness and adds depth.
  • Ingredient prep secret: Always taste your jalape√±os before using them; some can be spicier than others. Adjust the quantity based on your heat tolerance.
  • Timing strategy: Prepare the dip a day in advance to allow the flavors to meld together, making it even more delicious.
  • Presentation hack: Serve the dip in a hollowed-out bell pepper for a unique and festive presentation.

structured_content.content: This holiday cranberry jalape√±o dip is a delightful addition to any gathering. With its vibrant colors and delicious flavors, it's sure to impress your guests. The best part is how easy it is to make, even for novice cooks! You'll feel accomplished serving this dish, and it's bound to become a favorite in your recipe repertoire. Don't forget to share your experience and photos on social media with the hashtag #cranberryjalapeno. Enjoy making this delicious dip!
